abstract.p: Young & Rubicam names Susan Mendelsohn executive vice president (S)

block.p: * Susan Mendelsohn was named to the new position of executive vice president and director for account planning at the Chicago office of Young & Rubicam Advertising, part of the WPP Group. She had been senior vice president and group planning director at the Chicago office of FCB Worldwide, part of True North Communications. Also, Larry Deutsch, director for business development at the Chicago office of Impiric, part of Y.& R. Advertising, was named to the additional new post of senior vice president and director for business development at Y.& R. Chicago. * Peter Mitchell was named to the new post of executive vice president and director for client services at Long Haymes Carr, Winston-Salem, N.C., part of the Lowe Group unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies. He had been executive vice president and group account director at the New York office of Saatchi & Saatchi, part of the Publicis Groupe S.A. * Kevin Bowra was named to the new post of interactive marketing director at the Morristown, N.J., office of Oasis. He had been senior manager for marketing systems at Nabisco Inc., Parsippany, N.J. * Maureen Citarella was named chief operating officer at Optima Direct, Vienna, Va., part of the Rapp Collins Worldwide unit of the Omnicom Group, succeeding Riyad Abu-Sharr, who left. Ms. Citarella had been solution delivery officer at ClientLogic, Nashville, Tenn. * Mauricio Galvan was named to the new post of creative director at the Vidal Partnership, New York. He had been creative director at Teran/ TBWA, Mexico City, part of the TBWA unit of the Omnicom Group. * Mickey Goodman, president for customer relationship marketing at Marketing Drive, Wilton, Conn., part of True North Communications, was named chief executive at e-Drive, London and Norwalk, Conn., a new unit of Marketing Drive that will offer database, direct marketing and digital marketing services. Sierra Communications, Wilton, which True North acquired, also becomes part of e-Drive. * Donna Imperato, president for North America at Cohn & Wolfe Healthcare, New York, part of the Cohn & Wolfe unit of Young & Rubicam, was named chief executive at the New York office of Cohn & Wolfe. She succeeds Diane Perlmutter, who is leaving.
